intro: Eupatorium christieanum var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy boneset, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem covered in fine, hairy pubescence, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense, flat-topped clusters called cymes. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, and is often found in the understory of forests. Eupatorium christieanum var. pubescens is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many familiar flowering plants.
